title: Mac McClung dominated the NBA slam dunk comp. Shaq says he just saved the contest
description: The 76ers' fresh-faced point guard was the undisputed star of the night. In every round of the dunk contest, McClung bungeed his 6'2" frame up to the net with flourish.

title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy went from comedian to icon of democracy. This is how he did it
description: As Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, expectations were low for Ukraine's president. But Volodymyr Zelenskyy has confounded both his allies and his enemies with his performance.

title: A new earthquake hits Turkey, as teams still respond to earlier catastrophic quake
description: Turkish authorities say a magnitude 6.4 earthquake, followed by a magnitude 5.8 tremor, struck the Antakya region around 8 p.m. local time Monday. The quake was also felt in Syria.

title: New Mexico prosecutors downgrade charges against Alec Baldwin in the 'Rust' shooting
description: The actor's lawyers argued that he had been charged under a previous version of a New Mexico firearm law. The change would reduce his prison time if convicted in the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins.

title: A huge winter storm is about to plague the U.S., even as some areas see record highs
description: The term forecasters are using to describe the overall weather pattern is "anomalous" — for its unusual cold and warmth. In California, it could be the coldest storm in years.

title: LBJ biographer Robert Caro reflects on fame, power and the presidency
description: Caro isn't solely interested in telling the stories of famous men. Instead, he says, "I wanted to use their lives to show how political power worked." Originally broadcast in 2013 and 2019.

title: Spinal stimulation can improve arm and hand movement years after a stroke
description: Two stroke patients regained control of a disabled arm and hand after researchers delivered electrical stimulation to their spines, paving the way toward a medical device that could aid movement.

title: A new museum will be built beneath the Lincoln Memorial
description: The new exhibit space, built into the memorial's cavernous "undercroft," will explore the history of President Lincoln and the monument that honors him. Construction is expected to finish in 2026.

title: Latest on Ukraine: The first anniversary of Russia's invasion approaches (Feb. 20)
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Brian 'Thee beast' fights his way to Kenyan gaming domination!
description: When his family fell into poverty, a young boy in Kenya found comfort and strength from video games. Now he's the country's gaming ambassador, a mentor to kids in the slums — and a firefighter.

title: Ralphie the 'demon dog' has been sent back to the shelter for a third time
description: Ralphie the Frenchie has been adopted several times, but has been sent back to the Niagara SPCA in New York due to behavioral issues.

title: Biden has made a secret trip to Kyiv as Russia's war there enters its 2nd year
description: President Biden often pledges to support Ukraine in its fight against Russia "as long as it takes." The risky secret trip to the warzone is aimed at showing he means it.

title: A year into the Ukraine war, the world's biggest democracy still won't condemn Russia
description: As the West isolates Russian President Vladimir Putin, India has doubled down on buying Russian oil. India's prime minister calls his country's friendship with Moscow "unbreakable."

title: The 'wackadoodle' foundation of Fox News' election-fraud claims
description: A woman who put forth election-fraud claims that even she described as "pretty wackadoodle" was a source for baseless claims aired by Fox News in 2020. The network is now being sued for defamation.

title: Turkey and Syria quakes prompt fresh worries about Istanbul's building safety
description: As Turkey's leaders promise a swift start to reconstruction efforts in the earthquake zone, attention is also turning to Istanbul — and whether Turkey's largest city is ready for a major quake.

title: How grown-ups can help kids transition to 'post-pandemic' school life
description: As children continue to navigate the most "normal" school year since the pandemic, 2023's School Counselor of the Year shares some advice.

title: Parents raise concerns as Florida bans gender-affirming care for trans kids
description: Florida's medical boards have voted to ban gender-affirming care for transgender youth. Families with trans children and medical providers who care for them are worried about the impact.

title: There is a myth about mass migration to Europe. But some people do risk it all
description: The challenges facing Africa are real, but depending on who you talk to, the solution is either to risk it all for a better life in Europe or stay on the continent and fight for a better future there.

title: Which type of eye doctor do you need? Optometrists and ophthalmologists face off
description: Optometrists are lobbying for more leeway to treat patients — and physicians' groups are pushing back. But it's more than a turf war, both sides say, as they explain why patients' vision is at stake.

title: After a slow start to caucus campaigning, Republicans start courting Iowa voters
description: With a series of high profile Republicans visiting Iowa, it's clear that the 2024 campaign season is underway. But this time around the race looks a little different for the Hawkeye State.

title: Biden says he'll back Ukraine as long as it takes. But some take aim at the price tag
description: Polls show a growing number of Americans feel the United States is giving too much aid to Ukraine. That's helped lead to calls for more scrutiny of how the aid is being used.

title: The FDA has recalled more than 300,000 bottles of Starbucks bottled Frappuccinos
description: The bottles of Starbucks' vanilla Frappuccinos may contain pieces of glass, the Food and Drug Administration said.

title: Heavy rains leave dozens dead in Brazil as cities cancel Carnival
description: The cities of Sao Sebastiao, Ubatuba, Ilhabela and Bertioga, some of the hardest hit and now under state of calamity, canceled their Carnival festivities as rescue teams struggle to find the missing.

title: 'All Quiet' wins 7 BAFTAs, including best film, at U.K. film awards ceremony
description: German movie "All Quiet on the Western Front" won seven prizes, including best picture, at the British Academy Film Awards. American Austin Butler and Australian Cate Blanchett took top acting awards.

title: A record 6,542 guns — 18 a day — were intercepted at U.S. airport security in 2022
description: With the exception of pandemic-disrupted 2020, the number of weapons intercepted at U.S. airport checkpoints has climbed every year since 2010.
